Package ch.zhaw.theluckyseven.frantic.model.server_client_communication

Class NetworkHandler.NetworkServer<T extends java.io.Serializable>

java.lang.Object
ch.zhaw.theluckyseven.frantic.model.server_client_communication.NetworkHandler.NetworkServer<T>
Type Parameters:
T - type of the Objects to be transmitted in the created NetworkHandler.NetworkConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
Enclosing class:
NetworkHandler
public static class NetworkHandler.NetworkServer<T extends java.io.Serializable>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
Network communication class used on the server side to handle connection request from clients. The class opens a port on the server host and allows the server process to wait for connection requests. As soon a request comes in a NetworkHandler.NetworkConnection object is created, which is used to handle all the communication between the two peers.

  • Method Details

    • waitForConnection

      public NetworkHandler.NetworkConnection<T> waitForConnection() throws java.io.IOException
      Blocks the current thread and waits for connection requests on the declared port of the NetworkHandler.NetworkServer object. Returns a NetworkHandler.NetworkConnection object representing the connection to a client if a successful connection has been established.
      Returns:
      NetworkHandler.NetworkConnection object representing the connection to the connecting client.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an error occurred while waiting (e.g. throws a SocketException if the port has been closed using the close() method.

    • setSocketTimeout

      public void setSocketTimeout​(int timeout) throws java.net.SocketException
      Throws:
      java.net.SocketException

    • isAvailable

      public boolean isAvailable()
      Does indicate if the server is ready and bound to the declared port.
      Returns:
      true if the server is ready and bound to the declared port, false otherwise

    • isClosed

      public boolean isClosed()
      Does indicate if the server has been closed. A closed server can not be reopened. To reopen a port, a new Instance must be created.
      Returns:
      true if the server is closed, false otherwise.

    • getHostPort

      public int getHostPort()
      Returns the port number on which the server is listening for requests.
      Returns:
      returns the port number (range: 1 - 65535) if the server is available, 0 otherwise.

    • getHostAddress

      public java.lang.String getHostAddress()
      Returns the host address in String format on which the server is listening for requests.
      Returns:
      host address in String format or "unbound" if not available.

    • close

      public void close() throws java.io.IOException
      Closes this Server and releases any system resources associated with it. Closing the Server, closes also all NetworkHandler.NetworkConnection objects created by the server and throws a SocketException on all blocking calls (e.g. waitForConnection()) on the server. If the Server is already closed then invoking this method has no effect.
      Specified by:
      close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface java.io.Closeable
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class java.lang.Object
